alert.note: Alert for Southern New Haven (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 4:47PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...MODERATE SNOWFALL POSSIBLE EARLY THIS EVENING... A band of moderate snow will move into the area between 500 PM and 530 PM. Visibilities may be quickly reduced to 1/2 to 1 mile as gusty northwest winds continue. An additional 1/2 to 1 inch of snowfall is possible before the snow tapers off and ends early this evening. Wind gusts of 45 to 50 mph are likely into tonight, and a Wind Advisory remains in effect until 400 AM EDT. Temperatures around freezing continue to fall this evening and overnight, with lows 17 to around 20 degrees overnight. Gusty northwest wind will produce wind chill values of 10 to 15 this evening and as low as around 5 above zero overnight. Motorists should exercise extra caution as snow develops and be prepared for rapid changes in visibility. Also, untreated surfaces may become slippery this evening as temperatures continue to fall.
